Package org.ginsim.common.xml

Class XMLWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ginsim.common.xml.XMLWriter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SVGWriter
    public class XMLWriter
extends Object
    A helper to write well formed XML documents.

    • Constructor Summary

      • XMLWriter

        public XMLWriter​(OutputStreamWriter out)
          throws IOException
        Create a XMLWriter with an existing Writer. Warning: the writer should use the right encoding, otherwise we may get into troubles.
        Parameters:
        out - the OutputStreamWriter as out attribute
        Throws:
        IOException - the io exception

      • XMLWriter

        public XMLWriter​(OutputStreamWriter out,
                 String docType)
          throws IOException
        Create a XMLWriter with an existing Writer. Warning: the writer should use the right encoding, otherwise we may get into troubles.
        Parameters:
        out - the OutputStreamWriter
        docType - doc type value
        Throws:
        IOException - the io exception

      • XMLWriter

        public XMLWriter​(OutputStream out)
          throws IOException
        Create a XMLWriter with an output stream. It will create a Writer for this stream, using an UTF-8 encoding.
        Parameters:
        out - the OutputStream
        Throws:
        IOException - the io exception

      • isValidId

        public static boolean isValidId​(String id)
        Indicates if the given string is a valid GINsim ID (contains only a-z, A-Z, 0-9, "_" or "-" characters)
        Parameters:
        id - the string to test
        Returns:
        true if the given string can be used as ID

      • addAttr

        public void addAttr​(String name,
                    Color color)
             throws IOException
        Add a color attribute to the opened tag. The color will be encoded as #RRGGBB
        Parameters:
        name - the string name
        color - the Color
        Throws:
        IOException - the exception

      • addAttr

        public void addAttr​(String name,
                    String value)
             throws IOException
        add an attribute to the opened tag. If the tag is no-more really opened it will return silently without writing anything.
        Parameters:
        name - the string name
        value - the string value
        Throws:
        IOException - the exception

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        IOException - the exception

      • addFormatedContent

        public void addFormatedContent​(String s,
                               boolean b)
                        throws IOException
        add a "text child", already formated: should _NOT_ be escaped
        Parameters:
        s - the string to add
        b - if true, then the file might get indented
        Throws:
        IOException - the exception

      • addComplexContent

        public void addComplexContent​(String s,
                              boolean b)
                       throws IOException

        Parameters:
        s - the string to add
        b - if true, then the file might get indented
